isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - OPERATION - ODOMETER

svcprocinfo.para: The odometer is a solenoid activated mechanical counter type unit driven by the Speedo/Tach module microprocessor.

svcsubproc.title: With Electronic Engines
svcsubproc.para: The Speedo/Tach processor will advance the odometer in 1/10 mile steps, based on the input signal over the data link from the engine ECM. Tire revolutions per mile, and axle ratios are the major factors in determining the correct signal. The ECM must be properly programmed to reflect the vehicle configuration. Other factors that can affect tire revolutions per mile are tire manufacturing tolerances, tire load, tire inflation pressures, vehicle speed and tire wear. Also refer to PROGRAMMING.

svcsubproc.title: With Mechanical Engines
svcsubproc.para:
The Speedo/Tach processor will advance the odometer in 1/10 mile steps after counting the appropriate number of speedometer sensor pulses as determined by the Speedo/Tach module DIP switch settings. The Speedo/Tach module must be properly programmed to reflect the vehicle configuration.
Other factors that can affect tire revolutions per mile are tire manufacturing tolerances, tire load, tire inflation pressures, vehicle speed and tire wear. Also refer to PROGRAMMING.
